org.eodisp.remote.jeri.internal.fastmux
Class MuxClient

java.lang.Object
  org.eodisp.remote.jeri.internal.fastmux.Mux
      org.eodisp.remote.jeri.internal.fastmux.MuxClient

public class MuxClient
extends Mux

A MuxClient controls the client side of multiplexed connection.

Author:
Sun Microsystems, Inc.

Constructor Detail

MuxClient

public MuxClient(java.io.OutputStream out,
                 java.io.InputStream in)
          throws java.io.IOException
Initiates the client side of the multiplexed connection over the given input/output stream pair. Changes for EODiSP: Moved the hardcoded maximal fragment size parameter to a constant and changed its value from 1024 to 16384.

Parameters:
out - the output stream of the underlying connection
in - the input stream of the underlying connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException

MuxClient

public MuxClient(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel)
          throws java.io.IOException
Changes for EODiSP: Moved the hardcoded maximal fragment size parameter to a constant and changed its value from 1024 to 16384.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

newRequest

public net.jini.jeri.OutboundRequest newRequest()
                                         throws java.io.IOException
Starts a new request over this connection, returning the corresponding OutboundRequest object.

Returns:
the OutboundRequest for the newly created request
Throws:
java.io.IOException

requestsInProgress

public int requestsInProgress()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Returns the current number of requests in progress over this connection. The value is guaranteed to not increase until the next invocation of the newRequest method.

Returns:
the number of requests in progress over this connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the multiplexed connection is no longer active

shutdown

public void shutdown(java.lang.String message)
Shuts down this multiplexed connection. Requests in progress will throw IOException for future I/O operations.

Parameters:
message - reason for shutdown to be included in IOExceptions thrown from future I/O operations

populateContext

protected void populateContext(java.util.Collection context)
Populates the context collection with information representing this connection. This method should be overridden by subclasses to implement the desired behavior of the populateContext method for OutboundRequest instances generated for this connection.
